poem:
**An Erosion of Green**

In the morning paper,  
inked leaves fall,  
a forest undone by paragraphs.  
Words of erasure dance  
against the familiar hum  
of a kettle warming—  
all that remains unchanged.  
Birdsong debates in the distance,  
a chorus of resistance,  
as I sit with quiet rage,  
turning tea to clouds.  
Who will speak for the trees?

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
